strengths: Exceptionally well-decomposed parallel architecture with a single data contract (types.ts defines 11 canonical interfaces).
Closed-loop design (audit -> fix -> validate -> re-audit) with automatic chronic detection after 3 iterations.
CLAUDE.md is substantive and operational with 8 Common Mistakes entries and a context-loading lookup table.
weaknesses: Zero tests. For a verification-focused project, having no tests is a critical contradiction.
Format compliance is 20% (8 of 10 files failing prettier).
Audit pipeline has never been run end-to-end.
critical_issues: Zero test coverage with no test infrastructure configured.

strengths: The before/after improvement loop is a genuinely valuable product mechanic.
README storytelling is strong with progressive disclosure.
Configurable panels create a platform effect.
weaknesses: Time to first value is too long.
Zero social proof -- no example outputs.

strengths: Heterogeneous model routing demonstrates understanding of model capabilities.
Closed-loop audit system creates a compound intelligence loop.
24 cross-referenced context docs show meaningful million-token context usage.
weaknesses: Agent Teams hasn't been proven to work.
Entirely specification-driven with no runtime logic.

strengths: TypeScript strict mode with 11 canonical interfaces.
Good Server Component / Client Component boundary.
weaknesses: No lazy loading or prefers-reduced-motion support.

strengths: README.md is outstanding -- 140 lines with clear value prop and architecture diagram.
Dashboard has ARIA labels and semantic HTML.
weaknesses: No example output or demo screenshots.

strengths: Clear one-sentence pitch immediately understandable to non-developers.
Clean plugin architecture with standard interfaces.

top_strengths: Genuinely novel closed-loop architecture with action item lifecycle tracking and chronic detection (Boris, Cat, Thariq)
Strong README narrative and configurable YAML panel system creating a platform effect (Cat, Jason, Ado)
Substantive CLAUDE.md with 24 cross-referenced context docs demonstrating compound learning (Boris, Thariq)
top_weaknesses: Zero test coverage -- a critical contradiction for a verification-focused project (Boris, Lydia, Ado)
Audit pipeline was unproven specification at time of evaluation (Boris, Thariq, Ado)
20% format compliance despite PostToolUse prettier hook (Boris, Lydia, Jason)

agent_a.position: Architecture scores 82 but verification at 48 drags composite to 69.

agent_b.position: Product value is real (narrative 82) but adoption path is too steep (58).

divergent_opinions.analysis: Both correct. Two distinct gaps: internal verification and external adoption.

agent_a.position: AI innovation 78 but emergent behavior 55 -- still theoretical.

agent_b.position: Feedback loop mechanic is genuinely valuable regardless of AI sophistication.

divergent_opinions.analysis: Thariq wants emergent AI behavior, Cat values the product mechanic.

action_items.action: Execute audit pipeline end-to-end with 6 parallel agents.
Add Vitest with 5 foundational tests for schema validation and state management.
Create example audit output and link from README.
Add CONTRIBUTING.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, and issue templates.
